etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + phonetic 昜(昜) (yáng) = open field on the earth -> field or place
etymology.interpretation: The character 場 combines the earth radical 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") with 昜(昜) (yáng) to indicate a physical location or field. The semantic component 土 emphasizes the connection to the ground or land, while 昜 provides the phonetic aspect.

examples.chinese: 运动场上人潮汹涌(運動場上人潮洶湧)。
examples.pinyin: Yùn dòng chǎng shàng rén cháo xiōng yǒng.
examples.english: Crowds surge on the sports field.

examples.chinese: 这个场地很宽敞(這個場地很寬敞)，适合举办大型演唱会(適合舉辦大型演唱會)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè gè chǎng dì hěn kuān chǎng, shì hé jǔ bàn dà xíng yǎn chàng huì.
examples.english: This venue is spacious and suitable for hosting large concerts.

examples.chinese: 音乐会场中回荡着美妙旋律(音樂會場中回蕩著美妙旋律)。
examples.pinyin: Yīn yuè huì chǎng zhōng huí dàng zhe měi miào xuán lǜ.
examples.english: Beautiful melodies resonate in the concert hall.
